subs.text: In a new product I'm working on, I'm including links to the blogs of the social media apps I use. I notice that most of them have one. This is why:
You can put a title on a post on a blog.
You can include links (invariably announcements have links).
So I'm looking for the official blogs of the social apps I use -- Mastodon, Bluesky, Twitter, Threads.
If so, what's the feed URL?

PS: It seems dumb to have two places for writing. Also I bet Bluesky wrote their own blogging software, which is why there's no feed for their blog, which is awkward because Bluesky itself has feeds. As a programmer, I don't think I could maintain both codebases, and i'm pretty sure the blog is the one that'll get abandoned. Update: they do have a feed for their blog. At some point there won't be a distinction between blogging and social media-ing. Remember the "tiny little text boxes" have to go. :smile:

PPS: Twitter's blog has a really shitty title, it shows up in the list as English (UK). That should be fixed to something like Twitter Blog. I know how this happens, obviously they're maintaining more than one language, so the title is given from their point of view. As a reader, it has to make sense in a list of feeds from different publishers. Here's a screen shot to illustrate.
